page.title: 02General Review (continued)
page.content:
Barrowby Church and School and the old part of the village situated on top of this escarpment. From this point wide views of the Lincoln Edge can be seen as far as Lincoln and its cathedral. The rest of the D block stretches North and West from the escarpment onto the gravel and alluvial soils of the valley of the River Trent. Sedgebrook is situated in the vale at the foot of the escarpment.
The area is served by one main trunk road (A.52) and several minor roads. There is a railway line (Grantham to Nottingham) crossing the block from East to West.
The area is covered mainly by highly productive agricultural land - the chief land use being for arable crops.
